data.title: BSRIA Soft landings
data.description: Soft Landings is a building delivery process which runs through the project, from inception to completion and beyond, to ensure all decisions made during the project are based on improving operational performance of the building and meeting the client’s expectations

data.title: EU Building Stock Observatory
data.description: The EU Building Stock Observatory (BSO) aims to provide a better understanding of the energy performance of the building sector through reliable, consistent and comparable data.

data.title: London Buildings Stock Model
data.description: London Mayor has developed a London Building Stock Model with the UCL Energy Institute. The model has data on every domestic and non-domestic building in the capital. [News from UCL, May 2018](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/bartlett/energy/news/2018/may/greater-london-authority-commissions-ucl-develop-london-buildings-stock-model)

data.description: transport / buildings / industry / etc. carbon calculator by BEIS

data.title: UK battery storage has become an economically viable investment
data.description: storage market in the UK has become a viable investment opportunity in just the past few months. Meanwhile, more than 300,000 battery storage systems [installed in German households](https://www.energy-storage.news/news/more-than-300000-battery-storage-systems-installed-in-german-households)

data.title: Innovative Financing Solution Alongside the Goldman Sachs Urban Investment Group
data.description: [Blocpower](https://www.blocpower.io/) in Feb 21 announced a $63 million Series A with the goal of leveraging advanced technologies, innovative electrification equipment and structured finance to provide green heating and cooling to America's aging urban buildings

Plenty of insights, check [UKPN project Shift](https://innovation.ukpowernetworks.co.uk/projects/shift/) with Kaluza, Octopus, ev.energy

data.title: Metering behind the Boundary Point
data.description: P375 proposes using Metering Equipment ‘behind’ the defined Boundary Point for Balancing Services (‘behind the Meter’), for Settlement purposes rather than the Boundary Point Meter.

data.description: Smart Export Guarantee (SEG) tariffs have been unveiled after the legislation came into full effect yesterday (1 January 2020), with pricing ranging wildly

data.title: salix financing under Public Sector Decarbonisation Scheme
data.description: The funding expired in Jan 2021 provided by BEIS has provided a great boost to the public sector at a time when so many are thinking about our environment, our economy and the future of our planet.

data.title: open source tool for smart tariffs
data.description: Vital Energi are leading a consortium of experts to drive innovation in the development and support of smart tariffs. The tool will be open source, [funded by BEIS](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smart-meter-enabled-tariffs-comparison-project-smarter-tariffs-smarter-comparisons) Jul 2020

data.title: V2G uk trial
data.description: geo are leading a BEIS funded consortium  that’s enabling domestic demand-side-response through our Hybrid Home in 24 UK homes.

data.title: Vehicle-to-grid: Where’s the smart money?
data.description: a comprehensive overview of V2G and V1G technologies and regulations. before regulatory changes come into effect, much of the potential value is from behind-the-meter optimisation

data.title: BOA unconstrictor
data.description: a very good article from Flexitricity explaining the balancing mechanism and the bid/offer acceptances structure

data.title: National Grid upgrades balancing mechanism tech
data.description: Sept 2020 - In launching the new API, National Grid ESO aims to make it easier for smaller assets such as batteries and small distributed generators to bid into the Balancing Mechanism

data.title: Bristol City Leap
data.description: City Leap is a series of energy and infrastructure investment opportunities that represent a big step towards a cleaner, greener Bristol.

data.title: Harwell Campus - EnergyTec Cluster
data.description: The EnergyTec Cluster at Harwell Campus has 57 organisations comprising of over 1100 employees and aims is to bring together the multiple capabilities of Harwell with the surrounding regions to help address the UK’s energy challenges, and the economic opportunities they present.

data.title: VPP leaderboard
data.description: Guidehouse Insights Leaderboard Report: VPP (Virtual Power Plant) Platform Providers by Navigant

data.title: li-ion versus flow
data.description: Despite many energy storage technologies vying for market share – including much-hyped alternatives like flow batteries, which position themselves as the long-duration technology of choice – lithium-ion has maintained its leading position in the sector.

data.title: Nemesys energy - University of Florence spin-off
data.description: A patented technology for electrical energy management and storage devices ( Hydrogen-Oxygen battery) that combines traditional/standard electric batteries with hydrogen injection for the production of electricity

data.title: Potassium Ion batteries
data.description: In recent years, K-ion batteries (KIBs) have attracted significant attention as potential alternatives to LIBs. This review comprehensively covers the studies on electrochemical materials for KIBs. Another paper shows [An Intrinsically Non‐flammable Electrolyte for High‐Performance Potassium Batteries](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/anie.201913174)

data.title: Graphene battery breakthrough
data.description: The startup [Nanotech Energy](https://nanotechenergy.com/) claims to be “the world’s top supplier of graphene” and plans to release a non-flammable, environmentally friendly lithium battery that can charge “18 times faster than anything that is currently available on the market” — within the next year.

data.title: Cambridge Carbon Map
data.description: The Cambridge Carbon Map will bring together town and University organisations to create a public map of carbon emissions for the city of Cambridge. It will be accessible to anyone with a mobile phone and will allow you to compare carbon emissions for organisations with a simple tap on your mobile screen.

data.title: SPECIFIC / Active Building Centre
data.description: Our building concept integrates solar technology into one system – that enables them to generate, store and release their own solar energy – both heat and electricity. Rolled out through The [Active Building Centre](https://www.activebuildingcentre.com/about-us/) seeks to revolutionise the way the UK designs, constructs and operates buildings.

data.title: Electricity generation charts by Ofgem
data.description: Ofgem data portal for the energy markets in Great Britain. This portal gives direct access to all of our interactive data charts in a single location, alongside indicators we consider key to our performance monitoring.

data.title: ICIS - Energy
data.description: global source of Independent Commodity Intelligence Services - ICIS connect data, markets and customers to create a comprehensive, trusted view of the global commodities markets, enabling smarter business decisions that optimise the world’s resources. check their [n2ex spot analysis tool](https://www.icis.com/explore/power-analytics/)

data.title: National Statistics Energy Trends: UK electricity
data.description: Data on electricity generation, supply, consumption and fuel use for generation.

data.title: Nord Pool
data.description: Nord Pool runs the leading power market in Europe, and we offer day-ahead and intraday markets to our customers. The day-ahead market is the main arena for trading power, and the intraday market supplements the day-ahead market and helps secure balance between supply and demand. Historical datasets are available on their website.

data.title: EPEX spot
data.description: EPEX SPOT is the leading exchange for the power spot markets at the heart of Europe. It covers Germany, France, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Belgium, Austria, Switzerland and Luxembourg

data.title: ICE pricing and analytics
data.description: Intercontinental Exchange builds, operates and advances global markets through information, technology and expertise. The leading pricing, analytics and market data offered through ICE Data Services support mission-critical processes across the front, middle and back offices of organizations around the world.

data.title: Recycling lithium-ion batteries from electric vehicles
data.description: Here we outline and evaluate the current range of approaches to electric-vehicle lithium-ion battery recycling and re-use, and highlight areas for future progress.

data.title: Electric Insights
data.description: Electric Insights was established by Drax Group to help inform and enlighten the debate on Britain’s electricity.

data.title: EIA

data.title: ENERGYDATA.INFO
data.description: ENERGYDATA.INFO is an open data platform providing access to datasets and data analytics that are relevant to the energy sector.

data.title: Elexon
data.description: Elexon meters data harvesting and comparison, balancing and settlement code (BSC), **lots and lots of data!** They also have an API, check this out [link](https://www.elexon.co.uk/new-balancing-mechanism-reporting-service-bmrs/)

data.title: Balancing Mechanism Reporting Service
data.description: primary channel for providing operational data relating to the GB Electricity Balancing and Settlement arrangements. It is used extensively by market participants to help make trading decisions and understanding market dynamics and acts as a prompt reporting platform as well as a means of accessing historic data

data.title: DRED
data.description: DRED  (Dutch Residential Energy Dataset) is the first open-access, publicly available dataset from The Netherlands. The data set live deployment consists of several sensors measuring electricity, occupants occupancy and ambient parameters in a household.
